alert.note: Alert for Creek; Okmulgee; Osage; Rogers; Tulsa; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 1:36AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Rogers, southeastern Osage, northeastern Creek, northwestern Wagoner, northwestern Okmulgee and Tulsa Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 136 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles north of Sand Springs to 6 miles southwest of Kellyville. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Sand Springs... Bixby... Sapulpa... Jenks... Glenpool... Coweta... Catoosa... Kiefer... Mounds... Kellyville... Jenks Riverside Airport... Turley... Tulsa International Airport... Oneta... Liberty... Gray... Hectorville... Leonard... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 198 and 241. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.

area.areaDesc: Creek; Okmulgee; Osage; Rogers; Tulsa; Wagoner
